III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12308 Application submission
Section (1) An agency shall act on a completed and signed application.
Description
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The foster parent's license expired against their wishes, as the
agency did not maintain adequate communication.
Investigation On 9/19/25 Complainant reported to DCWL that Foster Parent
stated they had attempted to contact Licensing Worker 1 without
success. Foster Parent’s license then expired, against their
wishes and with no communication from the agency. This
occurred in August 2025 and as of September 2025 Foster Parent
wished to be licensed to accept placement of a specific child.
Complainant was contacted via email on 9/19/25 and indicated
they did not have additional information. Complainant was
contacted again on 9/22/25 to verify contact information for Foster
Parent.
Interviews:
Foster Parent was contacted by phone call and text on 9/22/25
and 9/25/25. The phone was not in service and would not accept
text messages or voice mail.
Licensing Worker 1 was contacted via email on 9/22/25 to
schedule an interview. Licensing Worker 1 reported she was not
assigned to the home at the time of the closure and had no
knowledge of the allegation. Licensing Worker 1 did not have
recent contact with Foster Parent regarding renewal of the license
or placement.
Licensing Supervisor was interviewed via video call on 9/25/25.
Licensing Supervisor confirmed that Licensing Worker 2 had been
assigned to Foster Parent. However, Licensing Worker 2 was no
longer with the agency. Licensing Supervisor recalled that
attempts were made by Licensing Worker 2 to contact the family
and complete the renewal process in April, May, June and July
2025. Foster Parent was not responsive to most of those
attempts. Licensing Worker 2 was able to schedule one home visit
for the renewal. However, Foster Parent cancelled the visit on the
day it was supposed to occur and indicated they would
reschedule. Licensing Worker 2 did not hear from Foster Parent to
reschedule. Licensing Supervisor advised Licensing Worker 2 to
start the process of sending written notification that closure would
2

occur if they did not complete the renewal process. The agency
never heard from Foster Parent and the license was submitted for
closure. A letter was sent to Foster Parent with information about
the license being closed and how to easily reopen the license if
they wished to continue fostering. Licensing Supervisor stated she
never heard from Foster Parent about reopening, nor had she
been contacted by Foster Parent or DHHS about taking a
placement. Licensing Supervisor stated they work hard to
maintain homes and do not take any closures lightly. The agency
would be happy to have contact with Foster Parent if they wish to
reopen their license.
Licensing Worker 2 was interviewed by phone on 9/25/25.
Licensing Worker 2 recalled that she attempted to contact Foster
Parent several times via phone call and text. A home visit was
initially scheduled for the license renewal but then canceled by
Foster Parent. Licensing Worker 2 stated she had difficulty
contacting Foster Parent at times due to their phone not working.
Licensing Worker 2 recalled sending the renewal packet to the
family 70-days prior to license expiration. After the family
cancelled the home visit and did not reschedule, or respond to
contacts by the agency, a closure letter was sent. The closure
letter indicated the license was closed but could be reopened if
the family contacted the agency and completed the process.
Licensing Worker 2 was not aware of any children that Foster
Parent was attempting to take placement of.
Documents Reviewed:
Review of Foster Parent licensing file in CWLM
• License effective 8/21/23-7/30/25.
• Documentation of renewal application sent to Foster Parent
was not on file.
• A signed renewal application from Foster Parent was not
on file.
• Licensing Worker 2 attempted contacts with Foster Parent:
o 4/21/25 Licensing Worker 2 left a message
o 5/7/25 Licensing Worker 2 sent a text
o 6/2/25 Licensing Worker 2 schedule a home visit for
6/19/25.
o 6/19/25 Licensing Worker 2 received call from Foster
Parent to cancel home visit. Foster Parent said they
would call back.
o 6/24/25 Licensing Worker 2 left a message to
reschedule
o 6/27/25 Licensing Worker 2 left a message to
reschedule
3

o 7/3/25 Licensing Worker 2 left a message to
reschedule
o 7/8/25 Licensing Worker 2 left a message to
reschedule
o 7/14/25 Licensing Worker 2 sent a closure letter
o 7/15/25 Licensing Worker 2 submitted home for
closure
• 7/14/25 letter to Foster Parent indicating the license was
expiring without renewal process being completed. Advised
the license was closed due to lack of response. The family
was thanked for their support and care and notified of the
simple process to reopen their license.
Analysis A violation was not found. Foster Parent did not submit an
application or complete the process to renew their foster home
license. The agency had documentation of attempts to complete
the renewal process with Foster Parent. However, the license was
submitted for closure, due to a lack of response by Foster Parent.
As of the date of this report, Foster Parent had not contacted the
agency regarding their license.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12306 Application request
Section (3) An agency shall provide the licensee an application for renewal
Description of the license and document the action not less than 60 calendar
days before the expiration date of the license. A renewal
application must be provided to a license, regardless of any
pending recommendation for disciplinary action of the license. .
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation The agency did not document an application was provided in the
required timeframe.
Investigation During a review of the foster home record in CWLM, it was
determined there was no documentation that a renewal
application was sent to Foster Parent as required by the rule.
Licensing Supervisor was interviewed via video call on 9/25/25.
Licensing Supervisor was aware documentation of an application
being sent to Foster Parent was missing from the file. Licensing
Supervisor confirmed the agency practice is to send a letter with
the application 70 days before license expiration. Licensing
Supervisor reported she would see if the document was at the
office but not uploaded or work with her agency to see if she could
4

access the files of Licensing Worker 2. Follow-up occurred on
10/6/25 in which Licensing Supervisor confirmed they were unable
to find documentation to show the application was provided to
Foster Parent.
Licensing Worker 2 was interviewed by phone on 9/25/25.
Licensing Worker 2 recalled sending the renewal letter and
application to Foster Parent 70 days prior to expiration. However,
as Licensing Worker 2 is no longer with the agency, they did not
have documentation to support this information.
Analysis A violation was found as the agency did not document an
application was provided to the foster parents within the required
timeframe.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. A corrective action plan is required.
